title: Move certification quick-access cards to top of Dashboard, Certification Selector, and Study Materials pages

requirements.text: On the Dashboard page (`frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx`), move the 8 CompTIA certification cards (showing difficulty badge, exam code, cert name, description, test score/progress info, and Study/Flashcards/Test quick-access icon buttons) so they appear as the very first content section immediately below the page header — before the 'Your Certifications' heading and any other statistics or informational content. The cards must retain their existing 4-column grid layout, dark card styles, amber/blue accent colors, and all interactive functionality.

quotes: these are the cardss that should be up top right under the header. the ones under 'your certifications' on the dashboard and the other two pages are good

acceptanceCriteria: The 8 certification cards (A+, Security+, Network+, Linux+, Cloud+, CySA+, PenTest+, CASP+) are the first visible content on the Dashboard page, directly below the header.
Each card displays: difficulty badge, exam code, certification name, brief description, latest test score or 'No tests taken yet', and Study/Flashcards/Test icon buttons.
The 'Your Certifications' heading and any stats/progress content that was previously above the cards remains intact but is now positioned below the certification card grid.
The 4-column grid layout, card styles, and all navigation links on the cards are preserved and functional.

requirements.text: On the Certification Selector page (`frontend/src/pages/CertificationSelector.tsx`), move the 8 CompTIA certification cards (with difficulty badge, exam code, cert name, description, domain overview, and Study/Flashcards/Test quick-access buttons) so they appear as the very first content section immediately below the page header. Any introductory text, domain detail sections, or descriptive informational content must flow beneath the card grid.

quotes: these are the cardss that should be up top right under the header. the ones under 'your certifications' on the dashboard and the other two pages are good

acceptanceCriteria: The 8 certification selector cards are the first visible content on the Certification Selector page, directly below the header.
Each card retains its difficulty badge, exam code, name, description, and Study/Flashcards/Test action buttons.
All descriptive text, domain overviews, and any non-interactive informational sections appear below the card grid.
Existing card styles, grid layout, and navigation behavior are unchanged.

requirements.text: On the Study Materials page (`frontend/src/pages/StudyMaterials.tsx`), move the 8 CompTIA certification cards (with cert name, exam code, study guide links/open actions, and reading progress bar) so they appear as the very first content section immediately below the page header. Reading progress bars and '% read' labels may remain on each card but the cards themselves must lead the page layout.

quotes: these are the cardss that should be up top right under the header. the ones under 'your certifications' on the dashboard and the other two pages are good

acceptanceCriteria: The 8 certification study material cards are the first visible content on the Study Materials page, directly below the header.
Each card retains its certification name, exam code, available guide listings, open/download actions, reading progress bar, and '% read' label.
Any page-level introductory text or secondary informational content is positioned below the card grid.
Existing card styles, grid layout, PDFViewer open behavior, and reading progress functionality are unchanged.

constraints: Do not alter the card designs, styles, animations, or interactive functionality on any of the three pages.
Do not remove or restructure the 'Your Certifications' section or any other existing content — only reorder so cards come first.
Do not modify any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
nonGoals: Changing card content, data, or backend queries.
Modifying any pages other than Dashboard, CertificationSelector, and StudyMaterials.
Altering the header, footer, or Layout.tsx structure.
Changing the Flashcards, PracticeTest, QAPractice, or StudyMode page layouts.
